page.title: 18LOCAL RADIO, HULL
page.content: As well as the national radio network run by the B.B.C. we are served by two {local radio stations.}Radio Humberside and Radio Viking. They run similar sevices including such items as local news, current affairs, traffic news, interviews with local people, both famous and not so famous, chat shows and copious helpings of popular music. The main difference between the stations is that{Humberside}is state run and paid for by the television licence fee and{Viking}is privately owwned and paid for by companies advertising their products and services. Both will tell you that they are best. Humberside used to boast the largest audience of any local radio station in Britain till Viking began broadcasting about a year ago.
